extendedIngredients.name: baby bok choy
extendedIngredients.original: 6 heads baby bok choy (about 7 inches long and 2 inches in diam at their widest), cut in half lengthwise
extendedIngredients.originalName: baby bok choy (about 7 inches long and 2 inches in diam at their widest), cut in half lengthwise
meta: ( 7 inches long and 2 inches in diam at their widest)

extendedIngredients.name: cornstarch
extendedIngredients.original: 1 tsp. cornstarch mixed with 1 tsp. cold water to form a slurry
extendedIngredients.originalName: cornstarch mixed with 1 tsp. cold water to form a slurry

extendedIngredients.name: dry sherry
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup dry sherry (or Chinese rice wine)

extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.original: 1/8 tsp. kosher salt; more as needed

extendedIngredients.name: prosciutto
extendedIngredients.original: 4 thin slices prosciutto, sliced crosswise into 1/4-inch strips (1/3 to 1/2 cup)

title: Braised Bok Choy With Sherry & Prosciutto
summary: Braised Bok Choy With Sherry & Prosciutto is a gluten free and dairy free side dish. One portion of this dish contains roughly 1g of protein, 4g of fat, and a total of 54 calories. For 32 cents per serving, this recipe covers 1% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. A mixture of soy sauce, garlic, kosher salt; more, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 8%. This score is very bad (but still fixable). Try Baby Bok Choy With Sherry and Prosciutto, Bok Choy, Shiitake, and Garlic Noodles, and Garlic Ginger Zucchini Noodle Bowl with Salmon and Bok Choy for similar recipes.
